about.summary: As a pipeline toolkit for Statistics and data science in R, the 'targets' package brings together function-oriented programming and 'Make'-like declarative workflows. It analyzes the dependency relationships among the tasks of a workflow, skips steps that are already up to date, runs the necessary computation with optional parallel workers, abstracts files as R objects, and provides tangible evidence that the results match the underlying code and data. The methodology in this package borrows from GNU 'Make' (2015, ISBN:978-9881443519) and 'drake' (2018, <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>).

As a pipeline toolkit for Statistics and data science in R, the 'targets' package brings together function-oriented programming and 'Make'-like declarative workflows. It analyzes the dependency relationships among the tasks of a workflow, skips steps that are already up to date, runs the necessary computation with optional parallel workers, abstracts files as R objects, and provides tangible evidence that the results match the underlying code and data. The methodology in this package borrows from GNU 'Make' (2015, ISBN:978-9881443519) and 'drake' (2018, <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>).

name: r-targets
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.11.4" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-targets
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/targets_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/targets/targets_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: bed256cb8f0c9a54c5efbca3424a13d7a0544ba404c8637817a14e2f7d894937

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-r6 >=2.4.1
    - r-base64url >=1.4
    - r-callr >=3.7.0
    - r-cli >=2.0.2
    - r-codetools >=0.2.16
    - r-data.table >=1.12.8
    - r-igraph >=2.0.0
    - r-knitr >=1.34
    - r-prettyunits >=1.1.0
    - r-ps >=1.8.0
    - r-rlang >=1.0.0
    - r-secretbase >=0.5.0
    - r-tibble >=3.0.1
    - r-tidyselect >=1.1.0
    - r-vctrs >=0.2.4
    - r-yaml >=2.2.1
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-r6 >=2.4.1
    - r-base64url >=1.4
    - r-callr >=3.7.0
    - r-cli >=2.0.2
    - r-codetools >=0.2.16
    - r-data.table >=1.12.8
    - r-igraph >=2.0.0
    - r-knitr >=1.34
    - r-prettyunits >=1.1.0
    - r-ps >=1.8.0
    - r-rlang >=1.0.0
    - r-secretbase >=0.5.0
    - r-tibble >=3.0.1
    - r-tidyselect >=1.1.0
    - r-vctrs >=0.2.4
    - r-yaml >=2.2.1

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('targets')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('targets')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://docs.ropensci.org/targets/
  dev_url: https://github.com/ropensci/targets
  license: MIT
  summary: As a pipeline toolkit for Statistics and data science in R, the 'targets' package brings together function-oriented programming and 'Make'-like declarative workflows. It analyzes the dependency relationships among the tasks of a workflow, skips steps that are already up to date, runs the necessary computation
    with optional parallel workers, abstracts files as R objects, and provides tangible evidence that the results match the underlying code and data. The methodology in this package borrows from GNU 'Make' (2015, ISBN:978-9881443519) and 'drake' (2018, <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>).
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brendanf
    - wlandau

# Package: targets
# Title: Dynamic Function-Oriented 'Make'-Like Declarative Workflows
# Description: As a pipeline toolkit for Statistics and data science in R, the 'targets' package brings together function-oriented programming and 'Make'-like declarative workflows. It analyzes the dependency relationships among the tasks of a workflow, skips steps that are already up to date, runs the necessary computation with optional parallel workers, abstracts files as R objects, and provides tangible evidence that the results match the underlying code and data. The methodology in this package borrows from GNU 'Make' (2015, ISBN:978-9881443519) and 'drake' (2018, <doi:10.21105/joss.00550>).

# Imports: callr (>= 3.4.3), cli (>= 2.0.2), codetools (>= 0.2.16), data.table (>= 1.12.8), digest (>= 0.6.25), igraph (>= 1.2.5), R6 (>= 2.4.1), rlang (>= 0.4.5), stats, tibble (>= 3.0.1), tidyselect (>= 1.1.0), utils, vctrs (>= 0.2.4), withr (>= 2.1.2)
